english_translation: Habah ibn Khalid, brother of Suwa' ibn Khalid.

potential_issues.issue: This is a biographical note, not a hadith transmission
potential_issues.impact: This is merely identifying a narrator's relationship, not a transmitted hadith

IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok

english_translation: Narrated by Habah ibn Khalid and Suwa' ibn Khalid: They came to the Prophet ﷺ while he was working on building or a wall of his, so they helped him.

narrators.name: Sulayman ibn Harb
narrators.full_name: Sulayman ibn Harb ibn Uthman al-'Abdi

narrators.name: Jarir ibn Hazim
narrators.full_name: Jarir ibn Hazim ibn Qabus al-Azdi

narrators.name: Habah ibn Khalid
narrators.full_name: Habah ibn Khalid ibn Suwayd al-'Abdi

narrators.name: Suwa' ibn Khalid
narrators.full_name: Suwa' ibn Khalid ibn Suwayd al-'Abdi

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abdul-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Jarir ibn Hazim is classified as a mudallis (does tadbis)
al-A'mash is a Category 2 mudallis but uses 'an (عَنْ) which requires careful evaluation
Salam ibn Sharhabil uses 'an (عَنْ) with ambiguous connection
Habah ibn Khalid and Suwa' ibn Khalid are classified as majhul al-hal (unknown reliability)

potential_issues.issue: Jarir ibn Hazim is known to practice tadlis (Ibn Hajar classification)
potential_issues.impact: While Jarir is generally reliable (Thiqah), the use of حَدَّثَنَا allows acceptance despite tadlis

potential_issues.issue: al-A'mash is a Category 2 mudallis using 'an (عَنْ)
potential_issues.impact: Category 2 mudallis are generally acceptable even with 'an, but this adds a level of ambiguity

potential_issues.issue: Salam ibn Sharhabil uses 'an with uncertain reliability (Saduq/Sadooq grade)
potential_issues.impact: The connection between Salam and the Companions through 'an raises authenticity concerns

potential_issues.issue: Habah ibn Khalid and Suwa' ibn Khalid are majhul al-hal (unknown reliability)
potential_issues.impact: These Companions appear unknown except in this transmission, making the chain weaker

Topics: Incident of the Prophet ﷺ working on building

english_translation: Jarrir said: Habah ibn Ghassil al-Asadi is from the Companions of Abdullah (ibn Mas'ud), and Abu Razin al-Kufi narrated from him (his statement).

potential_issues.issue: This is a biographical note about a narrator, not a transmitted hadith
potential_issues.impact: This identifies Habah ibn Ghassil as a student of Ibn Mas'ud and mentions Abu Razin as his student

IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok

english_translation: Narrated from Ali and from Ibn Mas'ud. Salamah ibn Kuhail and Thabit ibn Harmuz narrated from him, and in him (the narrator) there is mention of bad/corrupt doctrine.

narrators.name: Ali
narrators.full_name: Ali ibn Abi Talib ibn Abd al-Muttalib

chainIssues: The chain is incomplete - only mentions hearing from Ali without complete isnad back to Ali

narrators.name: Ibn Mas'ud
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Mas'ud ibn Ghafil al-Hadhali

chainIssues: Incomplete chain - narrators Salamah ibn Kuhail and Thabit ibn Harmuz are mentioned as narrators from an unnamed person, but there is no clear chain structure

potential_issues.issue: The isnad is fragmentary and incomplete
potential_issues.impact: The transmission chain is broken and unclear, making it impossible to establish proper authenticity

potential_issues.issue: Mention of 'bad/corrupt doctrine' in the unnamed narrator
potential_issues.impact: This suggests there are reliability concerns with the transmitter, though not explicitly stated

IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok
